p: The antioxidant effect of thyme extract has been analyzed in various studies, such as that carried out by Haraguchi et al. [ 47], who verified the properties of Thymus vulgaris extract as a protector against the oxidation of the lipids present in biological membranes, identifying components in the extract with substantial antioxidant power. Moreover, flavonoids that have been isolated from the concentrate of this plant show comparable activity to that of BHT, Î±-tocopherol or L-ascorbic acid [ 48]. In the study conducted by Venskutonis et al. [ 49], it was shown that thyme extract is an effective inhibitor of xanthine oxidase, an enzyme in the group of oxidized reductases that produces oxygen free radicals.
